intro: Listera microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved twayblade, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces delicate white or pale pink flowers in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, organic soil. Listera microphylla is often found in association with other woodland wildflowers, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
